lines.text: I think we've seen about a million today.

[to baby Boy]
Now see that you turn on the charm, because I don't think Tarzan approves of strange young men.
Now say 'Thank you, Father! Thank you, Father!'

[places baby Boy in the cradle]
Isn't he adorable? Um Tarzan, would you watch him for a minute?
Yes, I have something to do in the kitchen. Would you hold his bottle and see he doesn't choke?
[Tarzan gives baby Boy his bottle. Boy grabs onto Tarzan's finger]
Oh look, he knows you already! He's laughing at you.
Tarzan, he's been with us more than a week now. We've got to find him a name.
Yes, like Tarzan, Jane, Cheeta. Baby's got to have a name, too. If the Zambilis hadn't taken those men out of the plane, we might have found a clue to his real name.

[laughs]
Elephant? With a little nose like that?
Later call Elephant. Now call Boy!
Oh, but that's not a name.
Well, after all, I am his mother.

[picks up baby Boy and hands him to Tarzan]
Then go to your father, Boy. And later on, he'll teach you all the things you'll ever need to know in the jungle. Then look out all you lions and tigers and snakes and crocodiles and cannibals out there in the jungle! The king has a son!
Jane not go! Jane not die!
Yes Darling. Everything's all right now.
